DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "DocketNumberFDA" : "IC10-CAF-01",
  "DocketNumberAAO" : "10--01",
  "Initiated By" : "Texas State Securities Board",
  "Allegations" : "It is alleged that alleged that I provided investment advisory services for Navigant Advisors, LLC without being registered as an investment advisor representative.",
  "Resolution" : "Order",
  "SanctionDetails" : [ ],
  "Sanctions" : "My application for registration as an investment adviser was APPROVED. I was reprimanded and assessed an administrative fine of four thousand dollars.",
  "Broker Comment" : "When [Partner] and I established Navigant Investment Advisors, LLC in 2008, we engaged the services of [Third Party] acting for RIA In A Box as a registration compliance consultant.  We provided him with all required registration information.  We did not begin to conduct the business of offering investment advisory services until we were advised by RIA In A Box that our registrations were complete and active.   When this issue came up, we went back to [Third Party], the founder of RIA In A Box with whom we had dealt directly, and were assured that all registration requirements were filed correctly.  He took up the issue on our behalf and advised us that he had hit a bureaucratic brick wall whereby he had shown documented evidence of compliance on our behalf but they would not find that satisfactory.  He advised that he would reimburse me and Navigant for the fines and we could continue operations or we could hire legal representation and fight this in court for an indeterminate period of time.  We opted for the more expeditious approach, paid the fines, and accepted his reimbursement."
}
